The Ramen Butcher is upbeat and noisy, with the word RAMEN literally nailed into the wall to remind you what you’ve come for.ORDER THE: orange-miso ramen with pork broth and ground pork and the classic tsukemen cold noodles dipped in a rich pork- and fish-based soup.THE VIBE IS: sardine-can-like. It’s always packed, occupied by 20-somethings who know good ramen and aren’t turned off by waiting 20 minutes for a table.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open every day: Monday to Thursday, from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. and 5 p.m. to 10 p.m.; and Friday to Sunday, from 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. No reservations.—Lindsay AndersonGrant HarderWE ALSO LOVEPhnom PenhA boisterous Cambodian-Vietnamese institution in Chinatown that’s still going strongKishimotoThe Drive’s no-frills standby for impeccable sushiLa Grotta Del FormaggioAn old-school Italian deli on eclectic Commercial Drive for sandwich savantsExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
